alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender; Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued March 15 at 3:10AM EDT until March 15 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures to around 30. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures to around 30 with mid 20s in the outlier colder spots. * WHERE...Portions of southeast North Carolina and northeast South Carolina. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, until 9 AM EDT this morning. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. Outside pets and livestock susceptible to the cold will need a sheltered location.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
